page.title: 02INTERESTING NAMES
page.content: {The Brake}- The hammer that broke the strands of flax. {Tosh}- carding comb for teasing out fibres. The Brake and the Tosh are Huguenot words which presupposes some kind of Huguenot presence or influence. {Beley}- {Belsey}- {Belsway}- valley of Baal. {Pit}- place of, cave. {Swinkie}- swine cow hill - swine cow. {Pittendreich}- grave of the Druids. {Kingsmuir} - the estate where Kings hunted on the moor. (near {Kingsbarns where the Kings had their barns) {Dun}- as in {Dunino} - fortified hill. {-ino}- by the stream {Wakefield - Waukfield }- where they wauked/rotted the flax
